title: Render room photo thumbnails with zoom in Hotel Rooms and Guest Browse Hotels

requirements.summary: Show all previously uploaded room photos in Hotel Area → Rooms, with thumbnail gallery + zoom, and preserve add/remove behavior in create/edit.
acceptanceCriteria: Hotel Area → Rooms lists existing rooms (not an empty state when rooms exist).
Each room row/card shows photo thumbnails using the existing `RoomPhotosSection` component (or equivalent consistent gallery UI).
Clicking any thumbnail opens a zoom/preview modal using the existing `ImagePreviewDialog`.
When editing a room, existing photos are shown and can be removed by the hotel owner, and newly uploaded photos are appended and saved.

file_operations.description: Update the Rooms listing Photos column to render thumbnails via the existing RoomPhotosSection (compact mode) for each room, and wire thumbnail clicks to the existing ImagePreviewDialog for zoom/preview. Keep current create/edit dialog behavior for adding/removing photos, ensuring it initializes from the room’s existing `pictures` and saves updated arrays. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Align gallery fallback/placeholder copy and thumbnail styling so it can be reused consistently in Hotel Area Rooms and Guest browsing contexts, while keeping it view-only (no edit/delete controls). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Display representative room photo thumbnails inside each Browse Hotels card and enable click-to-zoom preview.
acceptanceCriteria: Browse Hotels cards show at least one representative room photo thumbnail when the hotel has rooms with photos (e.g., first available room’s first photo).
If a hotel has no room photos, the card shows a clear ‘No photos available’ placeholder state (English text).
Clicking a thumbnail opens the existing `ImagePreviewDialog` for zoom/preview.
The page remains responsive and keeps existing navigation behavior (‘View Details & Book’ still works).

file_operations.description: Enhance hotel cards to render a representative room photo thumbnail (derived from hotel.rooms -> room.pictures) and show a ‘No photos available’ placeholder when none exist; add a page-level ImagePreviewDialog and wire thumbnail clicks to open it without affecting existing navigation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Confirm the dialog styling supports a consistent zoom/preview experience across Browse Hotels and Hotel/Room galleries (no functional change beyond any necessary styling/props alignment). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Ensure room photo UI controls are role-appropriate: hotel owners can add/remove in create/edit; guests are view-only everywhere.
acceptanceCriteria: Guest-facing pages (Browse Hotels, Hotel Detail) do not render any photo upload/remove/edit controls.
Hotel Area renders upload/remove controls only where appropriate (room create/edit flows).
No admin-only UI is required for this change; do not introduce admin edit/delete for room photos if the intended behavior is view-only there.

file_operations.description: Harden UI permission boundaries for photo management: ensure upload/remove controls are only rendered inside hotel-owner create/edit flows and remain hidden/disabled for any view-only roles, while keeping thumbnail preview available for all viewers of the RoomsPanel. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Verify guest-facing hotel detail remains strictly view-only for room photos (no upload/remove UI), while keeping RoomPhotosSection thumbnail click-to-zoom wired to ImagePreviewDialog consistently. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent warm hospitality theme (neutral backgrounds + orange accents) across Hotel Area Rooms, Browse Hotels, and Hotel Detail photo sections.
acceptanceCriteria: Browse Hotels and Hotel Area Rooms use consistent card layout, spacing, and thumbnail styling.
Primary accents use warm/orange tones; blue/purple are not used as the main theme colors.
All user-facing text introduced/changed by this work is in English.

file_operations.description: Unify card layout, spacing, and thumbnail presentation with Hotel Area/Hotel Detail using the existing Tailwind theme tokens (primary/secondary/muted) to maintain warm/orange accents and neutral surfaces; ensure any newly introduced text is English.

Align Rooms listing card/table spacing and thumbnail styling with Browse Hotels and Hotel Detail using existing theme tokens (primary/muted/border) to preserve warm hospitality look and avoid blue/purple as primary accents.
Ensure room cards and photo thumbnails match the same warm/orange accent styling and consistent spacing used in Browse Hotels and Hotel Area Rooms; keep all changed text in English.

If needed, fine-tune global theme variables (neutral backgrounds + orange primary) to keep affected pages visually consistent without introducing blue/purple as primary colors; do not add new global stylesheet entry points.
